content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a crumbly pinch/crimp on the arete and right in an obvious pocket crimp. Pick some feet, pull on, and shoot to the lip. Top out.
content.location: Located on the same boulder as Pulsating Core, but in the alley between Core Cluster and the Prohibition Boulder. This line is located on the left in the alley where you step up onto the platform that houses The Bootleg.

content.description: Sit start matched on a jug. Find some feet and pull up to the lip, match and topout. Short, comfy grips and fun. Good intro for beginners.
content.location: This climb is found just to the right of "Slippery People" on the face. Starts on an obvious jug and goes to the lip.

content.description: A cool sharp crimp climb with a toe hook. Start on the edges down low and go up left to a high half circle crimp then use a toe hook to get a right half circle crimp near it and hit the jug out left and traverse the lip right to finish.
content.location: Look at Pulsating Core and follow the banana boulder on the left of it to the back side and this is in the cave with a roof above it right near there. Or just go downhill from Bootleg

content.description: A super steep classic overhang with large sloping pinches and rails.  Stand start with the right hand on a large horizontal rail and the left hand on the large sloping pinch found on the arete. Choose your jug foot wisely and make a few hard moves up to more sloping holds before taking a massive foot cut or figuring out some tricky beta. A huck for the lip gains a massive jug and an easy topout.
content.protection: 4 pads. The landing is fairly good, but when holding the swing you can get ejected.
content.location:
This classic is found facing the main trail that leads up to Waimea, but it is barely visible from the trail due to a small boulder in the line of sight. From the trail intersection (the one that forks to Bonsai and Waimea) or "Bobby's Problem". Hike 10 yards up the hill then take the faint diagonal trail that veers out left. Follow this up past a decent sized boulder and do a few tricky steps up onto a small rock. Once on top of this rock, "Pulsating Core" and the Core Cluster will be directly in front of you.

 Another method to approach this area is to hike up to the Block Boulder, then around the backside and 10 yards up the hill and slightly right.

content.description:
Sit start with a high left hand edge. there are three options for the left, one is further out left and puts a rock under your elbow, then there is a small incut edge found to the right, just above this edge there is another edge that is bigger, this is the one I decided to use. Right hand start on a sloping sidepull feature down and to the right.

 Pulling off the ground and doing the first move is the crux, unlocking the beta was tricky. Once off the ground latch the good rail with the right hand, then move rightwards on the slopey rail. Once on the right side of the rail, make a big move to a jug, the continue traversing along the lip to the right until you can topout.

 There is a detached block forming a roof above this problem. This roof block was not used or touched during the FA of this problem.
content.location: This problem is found in the cave-like feature that is home to "Slippery People". It is found just to the left of the mentioned climb.

content.description: This is a fun compression and sloper line. Stand start with the left hand under the roof on a full pad rail and the right hand on the lip of the roof. Pull on and get a heel-hook before smacking up with the right hand to some slopers. figure out the balance point in order to come in for the match on the slopers. From here, a few more moves left and a big lock-off/ mantle up to the top of the boulder completes the climb.
content.protection: 2-4 pads and a spotter. Most of the travel is lateral, rather than up.
content.location: This problem is found on the downhill side of the banana shaped boulder, which is adjacent to "Pulsating Core".

content.description: An isolated area located only 45 yards up the hill from "Bobby's Problem". This is a nice area with a cluster of good problems including the classic V6 "Pulsating Core".
